alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Chase; Hayes; Keith; Lincoln; Logan; McPherson; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Arthur, eastern Perkins, eastern Keith, northeastern Chase, western Lincoln, west central Logan, southern McPherson and northwestern Hayes Counties through 900 PM CDT/800 PM MDT/... At 814 PM CDT/714 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Arthur to near Paxton to 7 miles south of Madrid. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tryon, Sutherland, Hershey, Paxton, Wallace, Elsie, Dickens, Sarben, Ringgold, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, Grainton, Coker, Flatts, O`Fallons, Nevens, Broganville, Big Bald Hill, Bucktail Lake, Diamond Bar Lake and Bucktail. This includes the following highways... Highway 92 between mile markers 178 and 218. Highway 97 between mile markers 4 and 34. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 138 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for southwestern and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Chase; Hayes; Keith; Lincoln; Logan; McPherson; Perkins
